Proton

A subatomic particle with a positive electric charge. About the same mass as neutron.

Neutron

A subatomic particle with no electric charge. About the same mass as proton.

Nucleus

Heavy cluster at the centre of an atom made up of protons and neutrons.

Nucleus

Heavy cluster at the centre of an atom made up of protons and neutrons.

Electron

A subatomic particle with a negative charge found in all atoms. They orbit the nucleus.

Atom

The smallest ingredient in an element. The atomic mass is the mass of a single atom in a chemical element.

Atom

The smallest ingredient in an element. The atomic mass is the mass of a single atom in a chemical element.

Season to Taste

More atoms with the same number of protons (atomic number).

Element

A substance that cannot chemically be broken down into simpler ingredients. Made of atoms with the same atomic number.

Element

A substance that cannot chemically be broken down into simpler ingredients. Made of atoms with the same atomic number (number of protons).

Stir Together

More elements can be mixed together by forming chemical bonds.

Compound

A combination of two or more different elements. This is the form you will most often encounter. Few elements are found uncombined in nature.
